summary: This research addresses the lack of inclusivity for LGBTQ+ individuals within the biology community, highlighting the unique challenges faced by LGBTQ+ students due to the intersection of their identities with certain biology topics. The authors note the absence of established guidelines aimed at creating welcoming learning environments for these individuals. Drawing on existing literature and their personal experiences as members and allies of the LGBTQ+ community, the authors propose actionable recommendations intended to foster inclusivity in biology education. These recommendations aim to raise awareness of LGBTQ+ identities and encourage discussions on transforming biology learning spaces to better accommodate LGBTQ+ individuals.
